location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: 'Chart Showing THE BANKS FISHED FROM MARICHCHUKADDI.'

physicalDescription.extent: Dimensions: 470 x 295 mm on sheet 475 x 320 mm.Materials: printed on paper.

mods.abstract: The map accompanies the Report on the Ceylon Pearl Fisheriesby Sir William Crofton Twynam, Superintendent of the Fisheries from 1862 to 1896 (Colombo, 1902). The map appears between pages 60 and 61 of the appendices to the report.The map shows an area to the south of Mannar Island. The map shows fisheries from 1837; series of fisheries from the Jubilee Fishery of 1887 to 1891; notes by Captain James Donnan; and note on Donnan's note by Twynam.The map was lithographed at the Surveyor General's Office, Colombo.
